name: Bedform Diversity / Sequence
functionStatement: Supports aquatic habitats through streambed material and bedform dynamics. Enhances habitat complexity and streambank stability.
descriptionMarkdown: Presence and clarity of expected bedform sequence (riffle-run-pool or step-pool) indicate organized transport and habitat variety.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Count presence of riffle, run, pool, or step-pool units and note whether sequences are intact.

inputs.label: Bedform Diversity / Sequence
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Clear riffle-pool or step-pool sequence with robust variety. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some diversity but partially uniform. / Mostly homogeneous bed with faint or missing sequences. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Flattened or artificially uniform bed. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

references: planform metrics (for example sinuosity) as supporting context.

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence
